title: Fremont: Hidden Corners
description: Explore Fremont's quirky landmarks and hidden gems on this walking adventure. From concrete trolls to Soviet statues, discover the stories behind the neighborhood's most beloved icons.
hunt_intro_text:
Welcome to **Fremont: Hidden Corners**!

Your adventure begins in one of Seattle's most *eccentric* neighborhoods. You'll discover quirky art, hidden stories, and secret messages tucked into everyday corners.

Ready? Let's go!
hunt_success_text:
**Congratulations!** You've completed the Fremont Hidden Corners hunt.

As the sun catches the skyline, you notice one final message etched into the sundial's base:

{{handwritten:elegant}}Every corner tells a story — you found them all{{/handwritten}}

Take a moment to enjoy the view — you've earned it!

locations.name: The Fremont Troll
locations.address: N 36th St & Troll Ave N, under Aurora Bridge
locations.location_riddle:
Your hunt begins beneath the Aurora Bridge, where a concrete giant clutches a Volkswagen Beetle in its grip.

On your map, someone has scrawled a note:

{{handwritten:scrawl}}Look for the year — the troll remembers{{/handwritten}}

Head to the coordinates to find your first location!
locations.location_found_text:
You've found it! The massive Fremont Troll looms above you, a quirky guardian of the underpass. Look carefully at the details carved into the concrete around you.

Find the **four-digit year** carved nearby on the concrete. Add the digits together and multiply the result by {{color:blue}}3{{/color}}. Enter the result as a 2-digit number (zero-pad if needed).

locations.name: Lenin Statue
locations.address: 600 N 36th St (Fremont Place N & N 36th St)
locations.location_riddle: A legendary traveler from another era stands where the crossroads meet — find the controversial {{color:red}}bronze{{/color}} with a raised arm.
locations.location_found_text:
You've arrived! Before you stands a towering bronze figure, transplanted from across the world.

This statue has quite a story — read the plaque nearby to learn more about its *unusual* journey to Seattle.

On the informational plaque nearby, find the **six-letter word** that refers to the statue's country of origin. Enter it in all caps (6 letters).

locations.name: Ophelia's Books
locations.location_riddle: Books stacked to the ceiling, a hanging {{color:orange}}wooden sign{{/color}} and the faint watch of a window cat will guide you.
locations.location_found_text:
Welcome to a reader's sanctuary!

This cozy bookshop has been a Fremont fixture for years. Take a moment to appreciate the carefully curated shelves before solving the puzzle.

Look at the wooden sign hanging outside — enter the **second word**, exactly as written (4 letters).

locations.name: Gas Works Park - Sundial
locations.location_riddle: Head toward the skyline and the water — a park made from *industrial bones* keeps time with the {{color:yellow}}sun{{/color}}.
locations.location_found_text:
You've reached the final stop!

Gas Works Park transforms industrial history into public space. Climb the hill to find the sundial — a perfect ending point with sweeping views of the city.

At the sundial, you notice three numbers etched around the base: the hours that mark the **beginning**, **middle**, and **end** of the day. Enter these three numbers in order (hint: think 6am, noon, and 6pm in 24-hour time).
